# Using pattern matching for XML element traversal:\n\
from xml.etree import ElementTree as ET\n\
\n\
@dataclass\n\
class Person:\n\
  name: str\n\
  age: int\n\
\n\
def parse_person(xml_elem: ET._Element) -> Person:\n\
  name = xml_elem.find('name').text\n\
  age = int(xml_elem.find('age').text)\n\
  return Person(name, age)\n\
\n\
def parse_people(xml_file: str) -> tp.List[Person]:\n\
  tree = ET.parse(xml_file)\n\
  people = []\n\
  for person_elem in tree.findall('person'):\n\
    match person_elem.tag: \n\      case 'person':\n        person = parse_person(person_elem)\n        people.append(person)\n    case _:\n      pass\n  return people\n\
\n\
# Sample XML file content:\n\
PEOPLE = '''\n\
<persons>\n\
  <person>\n\    <name>John Doe</name>\n\    <age>30</age>\n\  </person>\n\  <dog>\n\    <name>Fido</name>\n\    <breed>Labrador</breed>\n\  </dog>\n\</persons>'\n\
\n\
if __name__ == '__main__':\n\
